TITLE: FTX spent $256 million on Bahamas real estate — now the island's government wants it back
SUMMARY: Bahamas regulators appeal to U.S. bankruptcy judge to try to claim ownership over FTX-owned properties in New Providence, Bahamas.

TITLE: Lawmakers unveil bipartisan bill that aims to ban TikTok in the U.S.
SUMMARY: The bill comes after years of broad concern across the Trump and Biden administrations about potential Chinese government influence on the company.

TITLE: Here’s the inflation breakdown for November 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Inflation was cooler than expected in November amid a slowdown in several broad consumer categories, according to the consumer price index issued Tuesday.

TITLE: Harvard-educated deception expert: 4 red flags can show when people like Sam Bankman-Fried are lying
SUMMARY: Pamela Meyer, a Harvard-educated deception expert and certified fraud examiner, weighs in on disgraced founders Elizabeth Holmes and Sam Bankman-Fried.

TITLE: The Fed has to portray itself as tough on inflation even as it pushes through a smaller rate hike
SUMMARY: The Fed is expected to raise interest rates by a smaller half percentage point Wednesday yet signal that its battle with inflation is still far from over.

TITLE: Binance temporarily halted withdrawals of stablecoin USDC as investor concerns mount after FTX collapse
SUMMARY: Changpeng Zhao, CEO of Binance, tweeted on Tuesday that the exchange is seeing an increase in withdrawals of USDC.

TITLE: Why tech insiders are so excited about ChatGPT, a chatbot that answers questions and writes essays
SUMMARY: Since OpenAI released ChatGPT last month, the text-based artificial intelligence tool has gone viral, attracting a million users in its first five days.

TITLE: Nuclear fusion breakthrough: Scientists generate more power than used to create reaction
SUMMARY: The National Lab and Department of Energy announced a nuclear reaction that generated more energy than was required to power it -- a first for humankind.

TITLE: Tesla shares have fallen 28% since Elon Musk took over Twitter, lagging other carmakers
SUMMARY: Musk sold billions of dollars worth of his Tesla holdings to finance the Twitter takeover and has been embroiled in controversy ever since.

TITLE: Two Americans and five Russians charged with running a smuggling network to obtain military technology and ammunition for Russia
SUMMARY: Two American citizens and five Russian nationals were charged with smuggling sensitive military technology and ammunition to benefit the Kremlin.

TITLE: The Arctic is getting warmer and stormier, and ship traffic is increasing as ice melts
SUMMARY: Nearly 150 Arctic scientists from 11 countries developed this year's Arctic Report Card.

TITLE: Musk's Twitter reportedly hasn't paid rent on its office spaces for weeks
SUMMARY: Elon Musk has recently taken drastic steps to cut costs and gear up for possible legal battles at Twitter, according to a report from The New York Times.

TITLE: Ford boosts production of electric F-150 Lightning pickup truck
SUMMARY: Ford Motor has added a third production shift to its Michigan plant that produces the electric F-150 Lightning as it looks to boost output.

TITLE: Workers and consumers say they're likely to favor pro-LGBTQ businesses, new study says
SUMMARY: A new report reveals companies that stay silent on LGBTQ issues could turn off their customers and employees.

TITLE: Apple launches a big update that makes your iPhone backups more secure. Here's how to turn it on
SUMMARY: If you opt-in to Apple's Advanced Data Protection, then Apple Photos, Notes and iCloud backups won't be accessible to anyone but you.

TITLE: CFTC piles on with new charges against Bankman-Fried, FTX and Alameda
SUMMARY: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission alleged that FTX commingled customer funds and that ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried violated the Commodities Exchange Act.
